repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**Problem**:
Currently, there is no easy way to get user-input in prompt-buffer before
the user submits the input. Under the current system user/plugin needs to read
the buffer contents, figure out where the prompt is then extract the test
if they want to. With the addition of multiline support, it becomes more
complicated.

**Solution**:
Add a new vim-function prompt_getinput({buf}) that gets the user-input
without invoking the prompt-callback

**Additional**:
- refactor: Extract prompt text extraction logic to a separate function

**Signature**:
```
prompt_getinput(bufnr) -> str
```

followup to #33371

comment_data.body: Who clears this memory? Does it get auto-cleared when the API return value goes out of scope? ASAN doesn't mind, I'm guessing it's auto-tracked somewhere.
You may need to add `FUNC_API_RET_ALLOC`
This function name is a bit vague. It's not immediately clear that it gets the user input.
Any suggestions?

`prompt_cur_input` ?

also a brief docstring helps when there is ambiguity.

Yeah, docstring would help. And probably prefixing it with `prompt_` is will make it distinct enough for an internal function. Any suggestions on `prompt_gettext()` ? Should I make it `prompt_getinput(bufnr)`?
either SGTM, slightly in favor of `prompt_gettext` since it aligns with `getcmdline()` (whereas `input*()` family of functions usually involves starting a prompt, not getting the current input?)

I think this should go to above the line above `- |stdpath()|`. Because as you can see, lines from `|system()|, |systemlist|` to `|searchcount()|` just document new feature for API that _already exists_ in Vim, not new API. And lines from `|dictwatcheradd()|` to `|stdpath()|` seem to follow alphabetical order
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -329,6 +329,7 @@ Functions:
 - |tempname()| tries to recover if the Nvim |tempdir| disappears.
 - |writefile()| with "p" flag creates parent directories.
 - |searchcount()|'s maximal value is raised from 99 to 999.
+- |prompt_gettext()|  gets current user-input in prompt-buffer

comment_data.body:
Reviewing `prompt_getprompt`, I think that `prompt_getinput` is a better name after all. Because `prompt_getprompt` vs `prompt_gettext` is very ambiguous. 

I will also update the docs for `prompt_getprompt` since "prompt text" is very ambiguous.

p.s. I don't really get why `prompt_getprompt` is needed at all. Especially if `':` works properly, `prompt_getprompt` just serves no purpose.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -7561,6 +7561,19 @@ prompt_getprompt({buf})                                     *prompt_getprompt()*
                 Return: ~
                   (`any`)
 
+prompt_gettext({buf})                                         *prompt_gettext()*

comment_data.body: this could be 1 or 2 lines in the above test :)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -522,4 +522,30 @@ describe('prompt buffer', function()
     source('set buftype=')
     eq(false, pcall(api.nvim_buf_get_mark, 0, ':'))
   end)
+
+  describe('prompt_gettext', function()
+    it('returns current prompts text', function()
+      command('new')
+      local bufnr = fn('bufnr')
+      api.nvim_set_option_value('buftype', 'prompt', { buf = 0 })
+      eq('', fn('prompt_gettext', bufnr))
+      api.nvim_input('iasdf')
+      eq('asdf', fn('prompt_gettext', bufnr))
+      api.nvim_input('<esc>dd')
+      eq('', fn('prompt_gettext', bufnr))
+      api.nvim_input('iasdf2')
+      eq('asdf2', fn('prompt_gettext', bufnr))
+    end)
+
+    it('returns empty string when called from non prompt buffer', function()

comment_data.body:
let's go with `prompt_getinput`. 

> p.s. I don't really get why prompt_getprompt is needed at all. Especially if ': works properly, prompt_getprompt just serves no purpose.

I think `prompt_getprompt` is basically a pair of `prompt_setprompt` as getter/setter. Currently, ': gives the start of the prompt not the end of it. Even if we are marking the end of the prompt, it'd require test manipulation where this function directly returns it. Since it's already in for quite a while, I don't see much reason to break it ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -7561,6 +7561,19 @@ prompt_getprompt({buf})                                     *prompt_getprompt()*
                 Return: ~
                   (`any`)
 
+prompt_gettext({buf})                                         *prompt_gettext()*

comment_data.body: These functions are sorted alphabetically, which means this should come between `printf()` and `prompt_getprompt()`.

```suggestion
• |prompt-buffer| supports multiline input/paste, undo/redo, and o/O normal
  commands.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -146,6 +146,11 @@ EDITOR
 • |omnicompletion| in `help` buffer. |ft-help-omni|
 • Setting "'0" in 'shada' prevents storing the jumplist in the shada file.
 • 'shada' now correctly respects "/0" and "f0".
+• Prompt-Buffer:
+  • supports multiline inputs.
+  • supports multiline paste.
+  • supports undo/redo on current prompt.
+  • supports normal o/O operations.

comment_data.body:
single-quotes usually mean "option". avoid single quotes. These days backticks are usually used for symbols.

```suggestion
/// Gets the current user-input in prompt buffer `buf`, or NULL if buffer is not a prompt buffer.
```

let's try to use a consistent prefix. also this could be static ?

```suggestion
/// Invokes the user-defined callback defined for the current prompt-buffer.
void prompt_invoke_callback(void)
```

```suggestion
      Gets the current user-input in |prompt-buffer| {buf} without invoking
      prompt_callback. {buf} can be a buffer name or number.
```
can we add `prompt_getinput` assertions in some of the above tests, e.g. for multiline input

comment_regular_data.body:
Let's keep any new prompt functions in the existing `prompt_xx` "namespace", not the Nvim api. I don't think we should spread the "prompt" concept into the Nvim api.

Instead, if we get around to [generalizing](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/30463) "readonly sections" in a buffer, then that kind of thing may be relevant in the Nvim api, but not prompt buffers specifically.

Meanwhile, should we introduce a new `':` mark that tracks the prompt start? That could also be useful in :terminal bufs.

> Let's keep any new prompt functions in the existing prompt_xx "namespace", not the Nvim api. I don't think we should spread the "prompt" concept into the Nvim api.

Should I expose it as api just as `prompt_get_prompt_text` ? Or expose it as vim/lua function?

> Meanwhile, should we introduce a new ': mark that tracks the prompt start? That could also be useful in :terminal bufs.

So ': is unsed till now? We can expose the mark that won't be an issue. Originally, I was thinking if we should expose the mark yo user or not

I think we work out the api plan after #33371 get's finalized.

> Should I expose it as api just as `prompt_get_prompt_text`

Same as the existing `prompt_` functions, a "Vimscript" function. It will be available to Lua via `vim.fn`. This keeps the family of functions in one "namespace".

> So ': is unsed till now?

Yeah. We have several things to choose from , but `':` seems like the best mnemonic.
Actually the `prompt_gettext()` name is a bit vague too.

> Please update `vim_diff.txt` as well

if neovim adds a new vim function, does it get added to `vim_diff`?

> if neovim adds a new vim function, does it get added to vim_diff?

Yes

title: feat(prompt): prompt_getinput() gets current input
